ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I witnessed graduate-level conversation about the nuances of victorian poetry, and learned more about recurring themes in the works of select victorian poets.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I am very grateful to have had a chance to be Professor Brisman's student, and to be in the company of such strong minds. We had a very powerful class--the discussions were vibrant and the members of the class were passionate about the course material. Strengths: I appreciated Professor Brisman's balance between sharing his own thoughts (more like a lecture) and inviting the class to share theirs. Our class was a healthy hybrid of professorial knowledge and student conjecture. Professor Brisman also encourages students to visit with him, which I found helpful--he makes himself accessible. Weaknesses: I think the class could have been stronger if Professor Brisman had cultivated more of a discussion among the students, rather than a question-and-answer style back and forth between the students and himself. The best seminars I have been a part of have turned into conversations between students, rather than timid references back to the teacher. Though I respect Professor Brisman's knowledge and I understand that he doesn't want our comments to stray too far from the interpretive mainstream, I think the class could have negotiated better between the two extremes.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, if you have some background in Victorian literature/poetry. This class requires a high level of engagement and can be challenging, especially when it comes to writing papers (Professor Brisman maintains high standards for essay-writing). But the exposure to some beautiful ideas and high quality poetry is worth it.
